alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 5:25AM EDT until April 06 at 12:07PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near East Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, East Juliette, Dames Ferry, West Macon, Macon, Clinchfield, Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Falling Creek near East Juliette. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. The rapid flow increases around 50 percent from the flood stage level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 15.2 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EDT Wednesday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 11.8 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 04/20/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
